results.definition: take possession of by force, as after an invasion
examples: the invaders seized the land and property of the inhabitants

results.definition: take temporary possession of as a security, by legal authority

examples: The sales clerk quickly seized the money on the counter
The mother seized her child by the arm
Birds of prey often seize small mammals

results.definition: seize and take control without authority and possibly with force; take as one's right or possession
examples: She seized control of the throne after her husband died
The patient was seized with unbearable pains
He was seized with a dreadful disease

results.definition: capture the attention or imagination of
hook by a pull on the line

examples: The rebels threaten to seize civilian hostages
